definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

pinyin: Guo2 min2 Nian2 jin1 Bao3 xian3

sentences.english: The present value of this annuity is, therefore, the difference between the values of the two perpetuities.
sentences.chinese: 使用年金桌子的現在價值是比較簡單的方式。

sentences.english: It is inter-dynamic that the developed country has already formed the supplementary pension and capital market.
sentences.chinese: 發達國家已經形成了企業年金與資本市場的良性互動。

sentences.english: Domestic institutions, including the main business at present accounts and annuities business.
sentences.chinese: 國內的機構業務目前主要包括年金和專戶業務。

sentences.english: The firm granted him a pension.
Give a man an annuity and he'll live for ever.
sentences.chinese: 給人年金，他就會長命百歲。

sentences.english: I still don't know what annuities are.
sentences.chinese: 我現在仍不知道年金爲何物。

sentences.english: The pension is not sufficient for living expenses.
sentences.chinese: 這年金不夠應付生活費用。

sentences.english: It will be an annuity kind of relationship, but there will also be lumpiness in revenues due to customisation.
sentences.chinese: 這將是一個年金樣的關係，但也將因改裝塊收入。

sentences.english: He lives on his annuity after retirement.
An annuity is a contract you make with an insurance company.
sentences.chinese: 年金是客戶與保險公司簽訂的一種合同。

sentences.english: Finally, this paper suggests measures for recompensing the older employees of their rights in occupational pension.
sentences.chinese: 提出了補償老年職工企業年金權益的設想和具體辦法。

sentences.english: Enterprise annuity for retired workers has become an important pillar old age security.
sentences.chinese: 企業年金已成爲退休職工老年生活保障的重要支柱。

sentences.english: Article 18 The items of the net assets shall present the net value of the enterprise annuity fund.
sentences.chinese: 第十八條淨資產類項目列示企業年金基金淨值。

sentences.english: We should regularize occupational pension and ensure the employees' rights.
sentences.chinese: 而要規範企業年金保障職工的權利只能依靠法律手段。

definition: the insured person/the person covered by an insurance policy
social insurance/abbr. for 社會保險|社会保险
certificate of deposit/time deposit/abbr. for 定期存款|定期存款[ding4 qi1 cun2 kuan3]
reinsurance (contractual device spreading risk between insurers)
